description.narrative: Feed the Children Tanzania is implementing a school feeding programme in Kisarawe and Kibaha Districts Tanzania. The right to adequate food as a basic human right was first recognised in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights in 1948 as part of the righ t to a decent standard of living. It became legally binding when the International Convention Economic Social and Cultural Rights entred into force in 1976. Since then many international agreements have affirmed the right to food among them the Convention on the Elimination of all forms of Discrimination against women and the Convention on the Rights of the Child. Even after all these conventions of which Tanzania is a signatory there has not been much done to turn those signatures into Actions. The main ob jectives of the project are, to introduce good governance and practical children rights model in 36 schools of Kibaha Rural communities, Modelling (Practical Implementation) of Child rights to food and enhancing child right to survival and development thh rough introducing and strengthening water harvesting system in 36 primary schools. Main activities for which funds are requested include: training of teachers Parents Local Government Leaders and children on children rights and good governance, establish water harvesting systems with water tanks, construct 5 energy efficient wood burning stoves, purchase of cooking pots, purchase of mugs, purchase of jugsplastic buckets stirs and initial supply of food soy-corn blend with mineral and vitamin supplement. tr ansportation of construction materials cooking utensils from source to each school establish 15 cassava school gardens, establish 15 mango school gardens construction of 5 basic half walled kitchens. Also increase community awareness in the project area on child rights and the negative effects of child short term hunger particularly in relation to child's school performance.The expected final results of the activities are, School Feeding Programme in 5 schools established with infrastructures and knowhow of running school feeding programme on their own, percentage of pupils attendance rate improved, pupils academicperformance improved, percentage of pupils droupout rate reduced in 12 schools, more than 4000 pupils physical growth enhanced through nutritious fortified food and sports activities, 10 000 awareness creation materials designed printed and disseminated (posters flyers etc)
